Last week, we released our 2020-21 School Selection Registration Form. The purpose of this form is to help us have raw data and numbers as we finalize our plans for September. For this reason, it is critical that this form is filled out before July 10th.

The easiest and fastest way is to complete it electronically at: bit.ly/MBAregistration2020 Should you prefer to send in a hard copy you may do so by mail, or during our meal distribution or Chromebook collection. Please make sure to complete it for each child that attends or plans to attend MBA for the 2020-21 School Year.

As a reminder, families who do not complete the form will automatically enroll their student in our hybrid model.

We understand and recognize you all have many questions related to school reopening in September (both virtual and in-person). We are closely following and monitoring this ever changing situation alongside national, state, and local officials. We will continue to provide updates and information as it becomes available.

Stay Healthy,
MBA Admin

Today MBA, along with many schools nationwide, closed in observance of Juneteenth, a holiday that memorializes the day Union General Granger read federal orders in Galveston, Texas that all enslaved people were free. The reading came more than two years after the Emancipation Proclamation was issued.

This June 19th, we are reminded that the legacy of slavery continues today in the forms of systemic and institutional racism, police brutality, mass incarceration, and lack of access to opportunities across society, including those in housing, healthcare, and education.

We know there is much work to do, and we have an important role to play in combating racism in all its forms. We are committed to helping create a world that is more equitable, inclusive, and compassionate for all our children. #mbacs #bracettibest #juneteenth

🌟 TEACHER CELEBRITY A L E R T!! MBA's very own, Ms. Strubeck--and several of her amazing students--were recently featured in Move This World's blog series for her innovative (and awesome) work in leading directed drawings with a focus in social-emotional learning. Started as a way to help her 4th graders connect in a non-academic way during the school closure, Ms. Strubeck's directed drawings have taken off leading to directed drawings with elementary classes across the US, teacher competitions, and most recently student-family collaborations.

If you haven't checked out her page or DD's yet, you need to!! Follow her on IG and Youtube at @MsStrubeck and through the hashtag #MsStrubeckLive.

Read the article here >> https://www.movethisworld.com/partner-spotlight-case-studies/sel-at-home-teacher-from-mariana-bracetti-academy-connects-her-classroom-with-sel/

We are SO proud of you Ms. Strubeck, thank you for being a #meaningfulcontributor to the larger community, and for demonstrating why you are #bracettibest.

post_text: The U•L•T•I•M•A•T•E #throwbackthursday picture. This was our last day at 2501 Kensington Avenue—our first home of 13 years. Previously it was home to an indoor flea market, and then its hallways became home to our students. Like many families who grow, expand, and find themselves in need of a bigger home, we left 2501 at the conclusion of the 2012-13 school year and opened the doors at 1840 Torresdale the following September. Teachers and students packed every book, paper clip and poster and our staff moved the entire school throughout the summer. Soon our new walls and halls were filled with students, their laughter and hard work and overtime 1840 became our new home. Still, those who walked the halls can’t help but smile when they think of 2501—it wasn’t perfect, but it ours and remains such a big part of our school history. #mbacs #bracettibest #mbavirtualspiritweek #dontforgetyourroots

This past weekend, 5 of our allstars spent the weekend in Washington D.C. at the annual LEAD conference. Leadership Experience and Development (LEAD) Conference offers experiential leadership skills development to students and advisers of National Honor Society. At LEAD, students and advisers sharpen their leadership skills with the goal to improve their school culture and community while networking with their peers from around the country. They were also able to attend the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum as well as walk and view the many memorials and monuments on the national mall. We are so proud of our students for being leaders at MBA. A big thank you to Ms. Matthews for organizing and chaperoning.

The safety of your children is our highest priority, and it is imperative that we practice a variety of emergency drills to familiarize students with necessary procedures. In addition to our monthly fire drills, we practice other drills throughout the school year. Tomorrow, the students and staff in grades 6-12 will participate in an enhanced lockdown drill to practice barricading the classroom door in case a violent intruder gains access to the building. Although evacuation should always be the primary response when safe to do so, we want to provide the staff and students multiple strategies to ensure their safety and security. We will conduct a similar drill with our elementary students once they have been prepared. Please support us by reviewing the importance of following all of MBA’s safety protocols and directions with your children. For more information on how we train our staff and students, please see the link below.

Thanks,

Your MBA family

Dear MBA Families,

We are excited to announce that we have made it easier for your family, friends and neighbors to join our school community!

Starting on September 28th, anyone interested in applying to our school for the 2019-20 school year can easily apply by going to applyphillycharter.org on their phone, tablet or computer, and following these three simple steps:

Create an account and fill out a family profile
Select the box next to Mariana Bracetti Academy
Submit the application

If you already have a child in our school and are interested in applying for a sibling, you will need to apply using Apply Philly Charter. At the end of the application, you will be asked if your child has a sibling already attending MBA. Just provide the current student’s name and birthdate.

If you know anyone who wants their child to join our MBA Family, please tell them to go to applyphillycharter.org to apply.

Sincerely,

The MBA Admissions Team

2018 Salutatorian - Luz Gonzalez-Mateo

The title of salutatorian is awarded to the graduate with the second highest level of academic achievement based on grade point average from grades 9 through 12. This student has always worked quietly, but persistently and it has been a joy to watch her as she served as our class treasurer and as a member of the National Honor Society. In her junior and senior years, she took challenging Advanced Placement courses in United States Government and Politics and English Language and Composition, and participated in MBA’s STEM program, helping to build an underwater rover, which was recognized this year by the Delaware River Basin Commission. Her compassion and drive will serve her well when she attends Drexel University in the fall on a scholarship. She has been a part of the MBA community since 6th grade and it has been a pleasure watching her bloom into a confident and directed young woman.
